wikipedia_page.main: General Sir Charles William Dunbar Staveley  (18 December 1817 – 23 November 1896) was a British Army officer.

link_mentions.page: Commander British Forces in Hong Kong
List of British Army full generals

response: Staveley was born the son of General Sir Charles Staveley, but did not follow his father and joined the Royal Navy. While serving as a lieutenant, he was in September 1902 posted to the Naval School of Telegraphy at HMS Victory, for a signals course, then the following month to the torpedo school at HMS Vernon for a short gunnery and torpedo course.
* Cecil Staveley (1874–1934), Royal Navy officer, son of Charles Staveley
* Charles Staveley (1817–1896), British general, son of William Staveley
